name: 楊士萱
objective: This course will address both theory and practice of video signal processing, mainly focused on video coding. The JPEG and MPEG standards will be covered in depth.
schedule:
1.Introduction
2.Entropy coding
3.Quantization and predictive coding
4.Transform coding and JPEG
5.Motion estimation and motion compensation
6.MPEG-1/2
7.MPEG-4/7/21
8.H.264 and beyond
9.Wavelet coding and JPEG 2000
10.Special topics in video coding (error resilience and error concealment, scalable video coding, transcoding, watermarking, 3D Video)

materials:
About Term Project:
You need to implement a video-processing algorithm by yourself in C, C++, Java, or MATLAB. Programs readily available can only be used as references. Some improvement or novelty is expected. Optimization toward practical use is necessary.
Topics should be chosen from the special topics (Chapter 10), or other emerging techniques with my approval. You must clearly identify your efforts and contribution.
Grading:
1.Proposal, 10%
2.Functionality, 50%
3.Oral presentation, 20%
4.Written report with simulation results and codes, 20%
Tentative Schedule:
Dec. 13 (Mon.):
-A 1-2 page written proposal with the topic, motivation, problem formulation, goal, and references.
-To determine the presentation order.
Jan. 3/5:
-Oral presentation with demonstration.
-15-20 minutes for each person.
Jan. 10 (Mon.): final exam and make-up demonstrations
Jan. 12 (Wed.): written report due (12:00 noon)
